result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Nicholas Dow

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant Robert Nicholas Dow in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik  in court for Robert Nicholas Dow.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Gondik waives preliminary hearing based on agreement with State
State- 2 year deferred judgment, final result a misd. if completed
Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause, binds him over for arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Robert Nicholas Dow in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik in court for Robert Nicholas Dow.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State indicates understanding that defense wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defense indicates that is correct, request set out to next week or after.
Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection

Adjustment Number: 22A 194604,
Payable Number: 151806,
Receipt Number: 22R 012681,
Amount: $20.00

9:16 AM Defendant Robert Nicholas Dow in court.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes defendant doesn't have an attorney yet
Defendant- Still waiting on appointment of Public Defender
Court presents options
Defendant waives time limits
Court accepts waiver, reschedules prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No use or possession of drugs or paraph. Don't operate a motor vehicle without a valid license or permit

1:36 PM Defendant Robert Nicholas Dow appeared by video, in custody. Att. Cogbill appears for the State. Ryan Reid appears for the defendant
Att Reid verifies address
State requests $500 cash bond, no drugs or paraph, Don't drive without valid license. 2 prior FTA's
Att Reid argues for signature bond
Court orders $1000 cash bond. No use or possession of drugs or paraph. Don't drive without valid license
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
